required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Fenofibrate And Microvascular Events in Type 1 Diabetes Eye.
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomised Trial to Evaluate the Efficacy on Retinopathy and Safety of Fenofibrate in Adults With Type 1 Diabetes. A Multicentre Double-blind Placebo-controlled Study in Australia and Internationally.

collaborator.agency: National Health and Medical Research Council, Australia

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the potential benefits of 145 mg of daily fenofibrate in adults with type 1 diabetes mellitus and pre-existing non-proliferative diabetic retinopathy.

detailed_description.textblock: Diabetes is the most common cause of adult onset blindness. Irreversible vision loss is a most feared complication of diabetes. Fenofibrate is a blood fat lowering drug available in Australia and has been shown to reduce eye damage in people with Type 2 diabetes by 35-40%, and to prevent eye damage in Type 1 diabetic animal models. This study will evaluate the potential benefits of oral Fenofibrate 145mg once daily for average 36 months in 450 adults with Type 1 diabetes mellitus who are at high risk of eye damage.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of clinical significant retinopathy progression.
primary_outcome.time_frame: As reported throughout the study and/or annual eye assessment post-randomisation
primary_outcome.description: Comprising 2-step progression of ETDRS score (to at least moderately severe grade), clinically significant macular oedema, need for laser surgery, need for intraocular anti-VEGF or corticosteroid therapy or vitrectomy, adjudicated to be for diabetic retinopathy (DR)

secondary_outcome.measure: The individual components of the primary endpoint
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, 12 m post-randomisation, 24 m post-randomisation and the end of study visit (which is on average 36 months post-randomisation).
secondary_outcome.description: Clinically significant retinopathy progression, 2-step progression of ETDRS score

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of clinically significant macula oedema (CSME).
secondary_outcome.description: Occurrence of clinically significant macula oedema (CSME) per standard ophthalmological assessment or laser therapy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Need for laser surgery for DR
secondary_outcome.description: Need for laser surgery for DR

secondary_outcome.measure: Need for intraocular anti-VEGF or corticosteroid injection or vitrectomy
secondary_outcome.description: Need for intraocular anti-VEGF or corticosteroid injection or vitrectomy for DR

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, 12 m post-randomisation, 24 m post-randomisation and the end of study visit (which is on average 36 months post-randomisation).
secondary_outcome.description: Visual acuity using ETDRS/LogMar or Snellen Chart

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, 12 m post-randomisation, 24 m post-randomisation and the end of study visit (which is on average 36 months post-randomisation).
secondary_outcome.description: Macular volume and thickness by Optical Coherence Tomography (OCT)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, 12 m post-randomisation, 24 m post-randomisation, the end of study visit (which is on average 36 months post-randomisation) and wash-out visit.
secondary_outcome.description: Albuminuria measured as urinary albumin:creatinine ratio.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At study completion and washout visit
secondary_outcome.description: Estimated glomerular filtration rate using Modification of Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD) formula.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, 12 m post-randomisation, 24 m post-randomisation and the end of study visit (which is on average 36 months post-randomisation).
secondary_outcome.description: Peripheral neuropathy status assessed by temperature & vibration sensation and monofilament test.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, 12 m post-randomisation, 24 m post-randomisation and the end of study visit (which is on average 36 months post-randomisation).
secondary_outcome.description: Autonomic neuropathy (QTc and R-R intervals) on annual ECGs.
Total cardiovascular events including myocardial infarction, stroke, sudden cardiac death, hospitalisation for acute coronary syndrome or any revascularisation events.

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency of foot ulcer and non-traumatic amputation.
secondary_outcome.description: Foot ulcer and/or non-traumatic amputation are reported by site during the study.

other_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and end of study
At baseline and end of study
other_outcome.description: Markers of inflammation, glycation and oxidative stress, angiogenesis and adipocyte function, and molecular markers, as change from baseline with study treatment

other_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, 12 m post-randomisation, 24 m post-randomisation and the end of study visit
other_outcome.description: Quality of Life questionnaire completed by participants annually

arm_group.description: 145 mg tablet of fenofibrate administered daily for 36 months.
Inert lactose tablet (otherwise matching active) administered daily for 36 months.

intervention.description: 145 mg tablet of fenofibrate administered once daily for 36 months.
Insert lactose tablet matching active tablet administered once daily for 36 months.

overall_official.affiliation: NHMRC Clinical Trials Centre, The University of Sydney
NHMRC Clinical Trials Centre, The University of Sydney

facility.name: Southern Adelaide Diabetes and Endocrine Services
